metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2162 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in iscsi_sw_tcp_session_create indrivers/scsi/iscsi_tcp.c in SCSI sub-component in the Linux Kernel. In thisflaw an attacker could leak kernel internal information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2162` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-lowlatency - 4.4.0-243.277
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-211-generic - 4.15.0-211.222~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-211-generic - 4.15.0-211.222~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-211-lowlatency - 4.15.0-211.222~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1122-kvm - 4.4.0-1122.132
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1159-aws - 4.4.0-1159.174
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1156-aws - 4.15.0-1156.169~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1165-azure - 4.15.0-1165.180~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1150-gcp - 4.15.0-1150.166~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-oracle - 4.15.0-1119.130~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-243.277').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-211.222~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1122.132').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1159.174').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1156.169~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1165.180~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1150.166~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1119.130~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
